distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.author: Christianson, Frank
bibl.title: Buffalo Bill's Great Plains, 1846-1879
bibl.note: Paul A. Olson Seminars in Great Plains Studies

div1.head: Buffalo Bill's Great Plains, 1846-1879
Paul A. Olson Seminars in Great Plains Studies Lincoln, Nebraska, January 18, 2012
div1.byline: By Douglas Seefeldt, University of Nebraska-Lincoln
div1.p: In this presentation, Seefeldt will share some of the findings from "Mapping Buffalo Bill's Great Plains," a digital history research project that examines and displays multiple perspectives on Great Plains history via the lens of the early life and times of William F. "Buffalo Bill" Cody. By contextualizing key events from Cody's 1879 autobiography, Seefeldt shows how Cody's Great Plains experiences move beyond the legendary and demonstrates the important role the region played in territorial expansion, the Indian Wars, environmental change, American commercial and technological progress and their concomitant legacies.
